awardEventDetails.title: 2009 Nominee Silver Ribbon
awardEventDetails.for: Best Non-European Director (Regista del Miglior Film Non-Europeo)

awardEventDetails.title: 2009 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.description: (WALL·E proves to this generation and beyond that the film medium's only true boundaries are the human imagination. Writer/director Andrew Stanton and his team have created a classic screen character from a metal trash compactor who rides to the rescue of a planet buried in the debris that embodies the broken promise of American life. Not since Chaplin's "Little Tramp" has so much story - so much emotion - been conveyed without words. When hope arrives in the form of a seedling, the film blossoms into one of the great screen romances as two robots remind audiences of the beating heart in all of us that yearns for humanity - and love - in the darkest of landscapes.)

AFI Awards, USA

2009 Winner AFI Award
Movie of the Year
(WALL·E proves to this generation and beyond that the film medium's only true boundaries are the human imagination. Writer/director Andrew Stanton and his team have created a classic screen character from a metal trash compactor who rides to the rescue of a planet buried in the debris that embodies the broken promise of American life. Not since Chaplin's "Little Tramp" has so much story - so much emotion - been conveyed without words. When hope arrives in the form of a seedling, the film blossoms into one of the great screen romances as two robots remind audiences of the beating heart in all of us that yearns for humanity - and love - in the darkest of landscapes.)
